page.title: 04THE FARMER
page.content: The farmer has been at Weeley Lodge Farm since 1942. He started off with 180 acres & it has gradually grown to 480 acres over the years. To look after all this, he only employs two young lads on his farm to operate all the machines. He grows mainly cereals with peas as a break crop. There are 2 sorts of wheat & 3 of barley. He rotates crops anticlockwise so the peas don't come round any more than every 5 years. The farmers try to help each other because his neighbours swap their farmyard manure for his straw which he brings back by trailer to his farm. One thing that concerns him is that the increase in wheat grown over the last 8 years has risen from 15 to 24 millon tons. There is a wheat mountain building up & there are not enough people to eat it all.
